string.text:
The Codec. A radio system used to pass on orders and communications between field, command, and support personnel, with radio transceivers used extensively in intelligence gathering operations. 
 
 Invented in the 2000s by the US Army, it incorporates anti-wiring coding, digital real-time burst communication. The device is standard issue for FOXHOUND operatives, a lifeline connecting them to their handlers, comrades, and enigmatic informants.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] technological item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate electric power consumption
